intro: Ptelea ambigens, commonly known as the western fringetop, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers. It thrives in rocky soils and arid environments, often found in chaparral and desert scrub habitats. The species is notable for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its potential medicinal properties.
